positive.review: Supporting a fighting game 7 years after it's release is so cool it made me do my first review ever.

Basically all my playtime has been me in training mode labbing stuff, as I've only played a few online matches to test the netcode. It's honestly frightening how much fun it is to think up team combinations or find ways to optimize your gameplan/combos. It's one of the most expressive and creative fighters I've played. Truly a game for the fighting game freaks of the world to sink their teeth into. Even in 2025 its a fantastic way to spend your time and money as its still being updated 7 years later.

PS. Check "https://isthereanydeal.com/game/dragon-ball-fighterz/info/" for a sale on the legendary edition for all characters, I've seen it as low as 23.USD before

I adore DBFZ! Even though one of my biggest regrets is not keeping up with it, I'm glad to play it from time to time! The combos in here are well thought out, the sprites are beautiful and the roster is pretty solid overall. My only real complaint with DBFZ and most Arcsys games is the way they do menus. I much prefer a list than a walking menu, but that's a small nitpick. I really do hope we get a DBFZ2 sometime in the near future. Easily a top 3 DBZ game of all-time. <3

This game is second only to BB CF in my list of best Arc System Works games, and it is second due only to it's lack of single player modes. It is an outstanding fighter and one of the best Dragon Ball games ever made. I played this on PS5 a lot, it is great to have it on PC now as well.

My review is based on the single player experience. This is probably one of the worst fighting games I have ever played. As a huge DBZ fan, I was very excited to get it, even more with the epic destructive finishes that, I must admit, were the main reason I got the game. Something I like about the usual DB games are the campaigns as they take you through DBZ story or make new stories based on it. However, this game single player is divided into 3 different â€œcampaignsâ€. Either you play with the heroes, with the villains, and with the androids. While the hero and villain campaign are OK, the android campaign is one of the worst things I have ever played. It is repetitive, and most of the story-telling videos between battles are Android 21 moaning because she is hungry. The story gets good until the heroes arrive and then you have more characters to play with. I finished the campaign, and I donâ€™t even want to get into the multiplayer. However, I can see is full of players, so maybe it is good, I am not going to test it to be honest.
The fighting gameplay is fun, but a little repetitive. Most of the time it involves either pressing constantly A, X, or Y while moving the character in different directions. Some combos are absolutely epic when you start combining characters and playing with character changing mechanics. This makes me think that the multiplayer mode should be fun.
More bad things: The number of characters is very low, you need to get a lot of them by paying DLCs, which is crap. The characters are not getting different transformations during battle, just for special movements.
I would recommend to get this game in a very big discount and donâ€™t lose your time if you like DBZ story modes.
